etymology.interpretation: Combines a specific species name with the general category, indicating a tree that is a pine. A straightforward endocentric noun–noun compound.
etymology.simplification: Traditional 樹 was simplified to 树 by streamlining the right component to reduce strokes; 松 is unchanged.

parts.english: tree; to plant; to set up; establish

examples.chinese: 这片山坡上长满了松树(這片山坡上長滿了松樹)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè piàn shānpō shàng zhǎng mǎn le sōngshù.
examples.english: This hillside is covered with pine trees.

examples.chinese: 冬天里(冬天裡)，松树依然常绿(松樹依然常綠)。
examples.english: In winter, pine trees remain evergreen.

examples.chinese: 我们在松树下野餐(我們在松樹下野餐)。
examples.english: We had a picnic under the pine tree.
